intro: Lobelia zombaensis, commonly known as Zomba lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats, often in forest understories. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Lobelia zombaensis plays an important role in its ecosystem, providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to local biodiversity.
